meta.title: United States Federal Government
meta.description: Simplified overview of the constitutional branches of the U.S. federal government.

nodes.label: U.S. Constitution
nodes.factoid: Foundational document establishing the federal government, ratified in 1788.

nodes.label: President
nodes.factoid: Head of state and government. Executes federal law and proposes the federal budget.

nodes.label: Congress
nodes.factoid: Bicameral legislature consisting of the House and Senate. Enacts federal laws and appropriations.

nodes.label: Federal Agencies
nodes.factoid: Cabinet departments and independent agencies that implement federal programs.

nodes.label: Supreme Court
nodes.factoid: Highest court, interprets the Constitution and federal law.

nodes.label: Federal Budget
nodes.factoid: Annual plan for federal revenues and spending submitted by the President and enacted by Congress.
